content:
• Wednesday, July 17, 2013
  • NXGN

    Quality Systems (QSII) said on Wednesday it has reached a settlement with Clinton Group, in...

    Quality Systems (QSII) said on Wednesday it has reached a settlement with Clinton Group, in which the healthcare IT company will look to add three of the activist investor's nominees to its board of directors. The board makeup will consist of six company nominees as well as Clinton Group nominees James Malone, Peter Neupert and Morris Panner. Clinton's nominees will be up for election at the shareholder meeting on August 15. Shares +1.1% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:05 PM
  • ACRX

    AcelRx Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ACRX) announces a public stock offering for a...

    AcelRx Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ACRX) announces a public stock offering for a yet-to-be-determined number of shares, with a 30-day option for the underwriters to purchase up to an additional 15% to cover over allotments, if any. Jefferies and Piper Jaffray are acting as joint book runners. Shares -2.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:01 PM
  • WDC

    SanDisk (SNDK) guides on its Q2 call for Q3 revenue of $1.53B-$1.575B, soundly above a $1.49B...

    SanDisk (SNDK) guides on its Q2 call for Q3 revenue of $1.53B-$1.575B, soundly above a $1.49B consensus. 2013 guidance is for revenue of $5.75B-$6.05B vs. a $5.82B consensus. Shares +6.7% AH to $63.40, close to the company's 52-week high of $63.73. Micron (NASDAQ:MU) +2.1% in sympathy. Thanks to a favorable NAND flash pricing environment, SanDisk posted a Q2 gross margin of 46.7%, up 610 bps Q/Q and 1840 bps Y/Y. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:54 PM
  • TTHI

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: TTHI +18%. PLXS +5%. SNDK +5%. AKRX +4%. AVEO +4%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: TTHI +18%. PLXS +5%. SNDK +5%. AKRX +4%. AVEO +4%.
    After-hours top losers: JAKK -21%. IDIX -7%. SCSS -7%. EBAY -6%. SGMO -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:46 PM | 1 Comment
  • HLF

    In his presentation at Delivering Alpha, Carl Icahn calls Herbalife (NYSE:HLF) the 'daughter of...

    In his presentation at Delivering Alpha, Carl Icahn calls Herbalife (NYSE:HLF) the 'daughter of all short squeezes," saying he hasn't sold a single share. Shares +0.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:41 PM | 3 Comments
  • CLB

    Core Labs (NYSE:CLB): Q2 EPS of $1.32 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $263.1M misses by $4.14M....

    Core Labs (NYSE:CLB): Q2 EPS of $1.32 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $263.1M misses by $4.14M. Shares -2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:38 PM
  • PLXS

    Plexus (NASDAQ:PLXS): FQ3 EPS of $0.68 beats by $0.10. Revenue of $571.9M (-6.1% Y/Y) beats by...

    Plexus (NASDAQ:PLXS): FQ3 EPS of $0.68 beats by $0.10. Revenue of $571.9M (-6.1% Y/Y) beats by $6.91M. Shares +5.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:32 PM
  • XLNX

    Xilinx (NASDAQ:XLNX) is guiding for FQ2 revenue to be flat to up 3% Q/Q. That implies a range of...

    Xilinx (NASDAQ:XLNX) is guiding for FQ2 revenue to be flat to up 3% Q/Q. That implies a range of $579M-$596M, above a $561.6M consensus. Shares +3.3% AH in response to the guidance and Xilinx's strong FQ1 beat, which was aided by a 300 bps Q/Q increase in gross margin to 69%. Gross margin is seen holding steady in FQ2. Industrial, Aerospace, & Defense sales +10% Q/Q and +9% Y/Y.. Telecom/data center +8% Q/Q and -2% Y/Y, Broadcast, Consumer, & Automotive +4% Q/Q and -5% Y/Y. Wired telecom and aerospace/defense are named strong points, as were sales of 28nm chips (exceeded $50M). Altera (NASDAQ:ALTR) +2.5%. Citi upgraded Xilinx last Friday. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:20 PM
  • SNBR

    Select Comfort (SCSS) slides 6.81% AH as the company misses on the top and bottom line with its...

    Select Comfort (SCSS) slides 6.81% AH as the company misses on the top and bottom line with its Q2 report. Company-controlled comps fell 6% Y/Y, operating income fell to $15.1M compared to $25.9M in Q2 of 2012, and operating margin fell 530 basis points from the previous year's quarter. Management's outlook remains unchanged at $1.30-1.45/ share for FY13; consensus is $1.37/ share. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM
  • EBAY

    eBay (NASDAQ:EBAY) is guiding for Q3 revenue of $3.85B-$3.95B and EPS of $0.61-$0.63, below a...

    eBay (NASDAQ:EBAY) is guiding for Q3 revenue of $3.85B-$3.95B and EPS of $0.61-$0.63, below a consensus of $3.97B and $0.65. 2013 guidance is for revenue of $16B-$16.5B and EPS of $2.70-$2.75 vs. a consensus of $16.3B and $2.75. The company says "macroeconomic headwinds in Europe and Korea will continue to be a challenge" in 2H. PayPal revenue +20% Y/Y in Q2, up from Q1's 18%. But Marketplaces revenue (exc. a tax gain) only +10%, down from Q1's +13%. Shares -5.5% AH. Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) -0.7% in sympathy. CC at 5PM ET (webcast). (Q2 results) (slides) (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM
  • XLNX

    Xilinx (NASDAQ:XLNX): FQ1 EPS of $0.56 beats by $0.09. Revenue of $579M (-1% Y/Y) beats by...

    Xilinx (NASDAQ:XLNX): FQ1 EPS of $0.56 beats by $0.09. Revenue of $579M (-1% Y/Y) beats by $29.68M. Shares +4.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • CYS

    More on CYS Investments (NYSE:CYS) Q2 earnings: The company puts together a neat table of...

    More on CYS Investments (NYSE:CYS) Q2 earnings: The company puts together a neat table of how agency MBS prices reacted to Fed actions during Q2, noting sharp drops in prices (and rises in yields) on the days of minutes releases and the June FOMC statement/Bernanke press conference. The volatility created "a dislocation between the value of our assets and hedges" Indeed. A must-read for all mREIT (BATS:REM) investors. At today's $8.89 close, the stock traded at a 12.7% discount to book value. CC tomorrow at 9 ET. Shares +2.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM | 5 Comments
  • EBAY

    eBay (NASDAQ:EBAY): Q2 EPS of $0.63 in-line. Revenue of $3.87B (+14% Y/Y) misses by $0.02B....

    eBay (NASDAQ:EBAY): Q2 EPS of $0.63 in-line. Revenue of $3.87B (+14% Y/Y) misses by $0.02B. Shares -3.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • IBM

    IBM (NYSE:IBM): Q2 EPS of $3.91 beats by $0.14. Revenue of $24.92B (-4.2% Y/Y) misses by $450M....

    IBM (NYSE:IBM): Q2 EPS of $3.91 beats by $0.14. Revenue of $24.92B (-4.2% Y/Y) misses by $450M. $1B restructuring charge recorded. Expects 2013 EPS (exc. restructuring charge) of at least $16.90, above consensus of $16.64 and prior guidance of $16.70. Shares +3.6% AH. CC at 4:30PM ET (webcast). (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM | 10 Comments
  • INTC

    Intel (NASDAQ:INTC): Q2 EPS of $0.39 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $12.81B (-5.2% Y/Y) misses by...

    Intel (NASDAQ:INTC): Q2 EPS of $0.39 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $12.81B (-5.2% Y/Y) misses by $90M. Expects Q3 revenue of $13B-$14B vs. $13.7B consensus. Expects 2013 revenue to be flat Y/Y, below prior guidance of "low single digit" growth; consensus is for 0.3% growth. Shares -1.7% AH. CC at 5PM ET (webcast). (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM | 35 Comments
  • MTL

    Mechel OAO (MTL +2%) sluffs off a downgrade to Underweight at HSBC Securities to finish higher...

    Mechel OAO (MTL +2%) sluffs off a downgrade to Underweight at HSBC Securities to finish higher today. The firm also slashed its price target by more than one-half to $2.20 from $5.60 per ADR.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • SNBR

    Select Comfort (SCSS): Q2 EPS of $0.18 misses by $0.06. Revenue of $207M (+1% Y/Y) misses by...

    Select Comfort (SCSS): Q2 EPS of $0.18 misses by $0.06. Revenue of $207M (+1% Y/Y) misses by $3.76M. Shares -7.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM
  • EA

    The NCAA has decided not to renew its game licensing deal with EA Sports (EA -1.6%); the...

    The NCAA has decided not to renew its game licensing deal with EA Sports (EA -1.6%); the organization says NCAA Football 2014 (released this month) will be the last game "to include the NCAA’s name and logo." The decision comes amidst an antitrust suit pursued by former players (led by UCLA grad Ed O'Bannon) over the use of their names and likeness in NCAA games. EA shares have dipped on the news.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM
  • NEPT

    Neptune Technologies & Bioressources (NEPT +4.7%) gains after George Haywood discloses that...

    Neptune Technologies & Bioressources (NEPT +4.7%) gains after George Haywood discloses that he's acquired a further 145,549 shares of and the company at a price of $3.70 per share. Haywood now holds 6.2M shares of Neptune, representing 10.2% of the float. Separately, the Canadian Intellectual Property Office has granted NEPT a composition patent covering omega-3 phospholipids comprising polyunsaturated fatty acids, the main bioactive ingredients in all recognized krill oils.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM | 6 Comments
  • PEP

    Nelson Peltz says Pepsi (PEP +1%) should buy Mondelez (MDLZ +3.8%) for $35 a share and tells...

    Nelson Peltz says Pepsi (PEP +1%) should buy Mondelez (MDLZ +3.8%) for $35 a share and tells Andrew Ross Sorkin that the problem at PEP isn't management, it's "structure."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM | 1 Comment
  • SGMO

    Sangamo BioScience (SGMO +5.2%) moves up after the company publishes research using zinc finger...

    Sangamo BioScience (SGMO +5.2%) moves up after the company publishes research using zinc finger DNA-binding protein technology to insert a gene that will essentially "silence" the extra copy of a gene that causes Downs Syndrome. The procedure provides a model for studing the basic biology of Down syndrom, and could enable the development of drugs that can potentially rebalance the cellular processes and pathologies that are affected by the disorder.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM | 1 Comment
  • DWDP

    Shares of DuPont (DD +5.5%) trade higher on a report from CNBC's Andrew Ross Sorkin that Nelson...

    Shares of DuPont (DD +5.5%) trade higher on a report from CNBC's Andrew Ross Sorkin that Nelson Peltz is "amassing a large stake" in the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM
  • USEG

    Shares in U.S. Energy (USEG +4.2%) trade up after the company gives an operational update for...

    Shares in U.S. Energy (USEG +4.2%) trade up after the company gives an operational update for its oil and gas drilling activities. CEO Keith Larsen says the company has multiple wells in development in the Williston Basin of North Dakota and is planning to start drilling the next two Buda Limestone formation wells in succession in South Texas, both of which look promising.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:03 PM
  • ALKS

    Alkermes (ALKS +5%) discusses three new drug candidates at its R&D day: An MS prodrug...

    Alkermes (ALKS +5%) discusses three new drug candidates at its R&D day: An MS prodrug program, a treatment for pain, and a cancer immunotherapy candidate. The company also announces the initiation of a Phase II study for the schizophrenia treatment ALKS 3831.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM | 1 Comment
  • VVUS

    Cowen's Simos Simeonidi says Vivus' (VVUS +1.8%) senior management and its board directors are...

    Cowen's Simos Simeonidi says Vivus' (VVUS +1.8%) senior management and its board directors are likely to be gone by Thursday or soon thereafter. Departures are expected to include the CEO, President, CFO and Chief Commercial Officer. VVUS management has been in a proxy fight with First Manhattan, with a clear win for the activist expected. The firm maintains a Market Perform rating on the stock with a price target of $13.50

     
     
     
     
    | 2:40 PM | 8 Comments
  • RBCN

    Rubicon (RBCN -2.5%) slumps after SA contributor Sneha Shah provides a critical take on the LED...

    Rubicon (RBCN -2.5%) slumps after SA contributor Sneha Shah provides a critical take on the LED sapphire wafer vendor. Shah makes note of Rubicon's plunging revenue and growing losses, its low barriers to entry, and the potential for materials such as gallium nitride (GaN) and silicon carbide (SiC) to act as sapphire alternatives for LEDs. Fellow SA contributor Valuable Insights offered a more bullish take on Rubicon last month, declaring the company on the verge of a cyclical recovery.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:36 PM
  • VSR

    Versar (VSR +10.3%) ramps higher after announcing that its RMC SoundEarth team has been awarded...

    Versar (VSR +10.3%) ramps higher after announcing that its RMC SoundEarth team has been awarded one of ten government contracts for environmental remediation services from the U.S. military. The contract consists of a three-year base ordering period with one two-year optional ordering period, with work to be performed at various locations throughout the U.S. territories. More details weren't given, but the combined value of all ten contracts won't exceed $250M.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:18 PM
  • CWEN

    NRG Yield (NYLD) delivers a strong IPO: after pricing its 19.6M-share offering at $22, shares of...

    NRG Yield (NYLD) delivers a strong IPO: after pricing its 19.6M-share offering at $22, shares of the NRG Energy (NRG -0.9%) investment vehicle opened at $26.75 and are currently at $27.29, up 24%. NYLD is promising healthy/reliable dividend payments via profits created by its base of electricity generation/infrastructure assets. (S-1) (IPO preview)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM
  • GRPN

    More bad news for leading Groupon (GRPN +5.7%) rival LivingSocial: the company has shuttered...

    More bad news for leading Groupon (GRPN +5.7%) rival LivingSocial: the company has shuttered both its NYC office and local events unit in an effort to pare costs. The moves come a month after the company closed its Seattle office and requested employees work remotely. LivingSocial, 29%-owned by Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN), posted a $50M net loss in Q1 to go with revenue of $135M (+23% Y/Y).
     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • TRIB

    Shares of Trinity Biotech (TRIB +4.6%) get a lift from an upbeat article in Barron's online...

    Shares of Trinity Biotech (TRIB +4.6%) get a lift from an upbeat article in Barron's online today, saying that with its diabetes testing equipment gaining rapid acceptance, the stock could gain 40% over the next 18 months. Since launching its Premier Hb9210 in 2011, the device has seeen strong demand. In 2012, its first full year of sales, the company shipped 202 of the Premier devices. This year, it estimates it will ship around 320, aided by its recent entry into China, a potentially large market for the device, with an estimated 54M undiagnosed diabetics.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:46 PM
  • ONVO

    Shares of Organovo (ONVO +13.3%) extend their advance today since shifting its listing to the...

    Shares of Organovo (ONVO +13.3%) extend their advance today since shifting its listing to the NYSE last week. After an initial dip on its first day of trading, the shares have climbed a combined 33% over the previous two sessions with more than a 10-fold spike in trading volume.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:31 PM | 8 Comments
  • AABA

    Yahoo's (YHOO +8.2%) latest acquisition is Admovate, a developer of mobile ad campaign...

    Yahoo's (YHOO +8.2%) latest acquisition is Admovate, a developer of mobile ad campaign management/targeting tech for marketers. The purchase addresses two fields - mobile ads and display ad tech - where Yahoo is considered to have a weak hand relative to Google and other rivals, and follows a Q2 report in which an 11% Y/Y drop in display ad sales was reported. Online/mobile ad management software firm Marin Software (MRIN +3%) appears to be rallying thanks to the deal. Yahoo, meanwhile, continues to rocket higher thanks to Alibaba's numbers. (previous) (Yahoo/AdMob deal)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:18 PM | 4 Comments
  • AXP

    American Express (AXP -2.1%) pares some of its loss after responding to a EU proposal to cap...

    American Express (AXP -2.1%) pares some of its loss after responding to a EU proposal to cap fees charged by banks to retailers to process credit card payments. Jefferies estimates the plan would cut AMEX EPS by about $0.11, but says the company can offset the loss through changes in its fees and rewards programs. AMEX notes the proposal is just that - a "lengthy" legislative process and extensive debate awaits.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:04 PM
  • KOG

    More on SunTrust's upgrade of Kodiak Oil & Gas (KOG +5.7%): Analyst Ryan Oatman thinks the...

    More on SunTrust's upgrade of Kodiak Oil & Gas (KOG +5.7%): Analyst Ryan Oatman thinks the company's downspacing efforts for its Bakken and Three Fork assets have a 50% chance of success, a little better than the 0% chance he believes the Street is giving them. Oatman argues shares could be worth $12-$13 if the efforts succeed, and will likely be range-bound at $8-$9.50 if they don't.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:03 PM | 2 Comments
  • MUX

    McEwen Mining (MUX -2.7%) releases an updated resource estimate for the El Gallo 1 mine in...

    McEwen Mining (MUX -2.7%) releases an updated resource estimate for the El Gallo 1 mine in Sinaloa State, Mexico. Measured and indicated gold resources grew by 38% to 691,523 ounces after mining depletion. Gold grades increased by 3% to 1.54 gpt. The company also says plans are underway to expand the mine's process facilities by 50% to 4,500 tons per day at an estimated cost of $5M.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:02 PM
  • XONE

    ExOne (XONE +5.3%) rebounds a bit from its 2-day drubbing after Stephens' Chris Godby defends...

    ExOne (XONE +5.3%) rebounds a bit from its 2-day drubbing after Stephens' Chris Godby defends the company. Godby asserts ExOne's decline gives investors a "compelling entry point," and that Q2 results (a point of concern after light 2013 guidance was issued) are nothing to be worried about. Stratasys (SSYS +2.3%) and Proto Labs (PRLB +2.2%) are also bouncing.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM
  • LBIX-OLD

    Midday top 10 gainers: LBIX-OLD +21%. EMITF +15%. MEAD +14%. EXXI +14%. UQM +13%. AVAV +12%. FAC...

    Midday top 10 gainers: LBIX-OLD +21%. EMITF +15%. MEAD +14%. EXXI +14%. UQM +13%. AVAV +12%. FAC +11%. INSM +11%. USU +11%. OTCQB:SURG +10%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: ZAGG -16%. VSTM -11%. MSN -10%. TGD -10%. IG -8%. CASM -8%. UIHC -8%. MAT -7%. DRAM -7%. FHCO -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • JOY

    Caught in the backdraft of Caterpillar's decline (Chanos says he's short) are Joy Global (JOY...

    Caught in the backdraft of Caterpillar's decline (Chanos says he's short) are Joy Global (JOY -1.7%) and Deere (DE -1.5%).
     
     
     
     
    | 12:43 PM | 4 Comments
  • WNC

    Wabash National (WNC -6.9%) slips after FBR Capital cuts the shares from Outperform to Market...

    Wabash National (WNC -6.9%) slips after FBR Capital cuts the shares from Outperform to Market Perform and lowers its price target from $15 to $10.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM
  • CAT

    Caterpillar (CAT -2.2%) tumbles as Jim Chanos - presenting at Delivering Alpha - discloses he's...

    Caterpillar (CAT -2.2%) tumbles as Jim Chanos - presenting at Delivering Alpha - discloses he's short. The commodity supercycle - spurred mostly by China (and we know his feelings about that country) - is coming to an end, says Chanos, and along with it is the soaring mining capex which has benefitted CAT.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:35 PM | 21 Comments
  • AAPL

    The iPhone 5S (AAPL +0.1%) will feature an "indestructible Liquidmetal case," thinks BGR's...

    The iPhone 5S (AAPL +0.1%) will feature an "indestructible Liquidmetal case," thinks BGR's Jonathan S. Geller after analyzing previously-leaked SIM tray pictures and finding similarities with Vertu luxury phones that used the material. Liquidmetal (OTCQB:LQMT +68.5%) shares have soared on the pink sheets thanks to the report. Geller also thinks (but doesn't elaborate as to why) the 5S might use sapphire cover glass; if true, that's a positive for GT Advanced (GTAT +0.4%), and an incremental negative for Gorilla Glass maker Corning (GLW -0.8%). Separately (take this one with a big spoonful of salt), Taiwan's Commercial Times reports the 5S may be delayed until year's end in order to support a 4.3" display.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:34 PM | 20 Comments
  • AVAV

    AeroVironment (AVAV +12.3%) issues a response to Engaged Capital's earlier announcement of a...

    AeroVironment (AVAV +12.3%) issues a response to Engaged Capital's earlier announcement of a 5.1% stake in the company, saying it welcomes open communications with all of its stockholders and values their input towards the goal of enhancing stockholder value. The company notes that the board regularly evaluates its capital structure and capital allocation priorities, and is confident that its strategy best positions AVAV to compete effectively and deliver superior returns.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM
  • TCPTF

    Thompson Creek Metals (TC +4.9%) spikes higher today, flying in the face of JPMorgan, who cut...

    Thompson Creek Metals (TC +4.9%) spikes higher today, flying in the face of JPMorgan, who cut the shares from Overweight to Neutral and removed its $5 price target. The firm cites lower metal price assumptions for copper, gold and molybdenum for the downgrade. It notes that it still expects the miner's Mt. Milligan project to drive significant earnings growth starting later this year, but regardless, earnings should hover around breakeven for the rest of 2013 and most of 2014 given lower moly and gold price forecasts.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM
  • UQM

    UQM Technologies (UQM +12.8%) moves higher today after disclosing a three-year contract to...

    UQM Technologies (UQM +12.8%) moves higher today after disclosing a three-year contract to supply the power trains for a new fleet of electric vehicles to Boulder Electric Vehicle in Colorado. The company said it began shipping the units over the past two months, with its PowerPhase HD 220 systems being used in three all-electric models: delivery vans, flatbed trucks and service body trucks. Financial terms of the deal weren't disclosed.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:55 AM | 1 Comment
  • BK

    More on BNY Mellon (BK +2.6%) Q2 earnings: Custody assets up 4% Y/Y. Investment services fees up...

    More on BNY Mellon (BK +2.6%) Q2 earnings: Custody assets up 4% Y/Y. Investment services fees up 4%, investment management and performance fees up 6%. Net interest revenue up 3.1%, with NIM of 1.15% off 10 bps from a year ago. The expense reduction drive continues with noninterest expense of $2.8B of 7.4% Y/Y. $900M in capital generated during Q2, funding $500M in buybacks and boosted dividend. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM
  • EGC

    Energy XXI (EXXI +14.7%) soars following Tuesday evening's reserve report. Helping the cause is...

    Energy XXI (EXXI +14.7%) soars following Tuesday evening's reserve report. Helping the cause is KeyBanc's David Deckelbaum who likes the company's shift to horizontal-based drilling and says the shares "are trading at a 17% discount" to his current NAV. For more, see SA Pro contributor Michael Fitzsimmons' latest piece; Fitzsimmons called the shares "vastly undervalued" in a Pro article published last month.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:33 AM
  • AVAV

    AeroVironment (AVAV +14%) pops after Engaged Capital takes a 5.1% stake in the aerospace and...

    AeroVironment (AVAV +14%) pops after Engaged Capital takes a 5.1% stake in the aerospace and defense manufacturer. The activist investor says that AVAV is suffering from a value disconnect, and the company is poised to capitalize on the increased use of unmanned aircraft systems.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM
  • PGHEF

    Pengrowth Energy (PGH +6.9%) surges after reopening for trade following the halt amid news its...

    Pengrowth Energy (PGH +6.9%) surges after reopening for trade following the halt amid news its sold off more non-core assets, helping to fund the Lindbergh project. "Pengrowth moves down the risk ladder," comments SA's Albert Alfonso, who penned a bullish piece on the stock one week ago.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM | 7 Comments
  • EBIX

    Ebix (EBIX +3.4%) rallies after announcing a deal with top Brazilian mobile carrier Vivo (owned...

    Ebix (EBIX +3.4%) rallies after announcing a deal with top Brazilian mobile carrier Vivo (owned by Telefonica) to provide health content to its users, via Ebix's A.D.A.M. content exchange. Ebix adds there's "strong potential for subsequent adoption" of its health portal offerings by Telefonica in other markets. Shares have bounced over the last 3 weeks, but remain over 40% below the $20 acquisition price Goldman once offered.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • GLD

    Ouch! Gold (GLD -0.8%) isn't liking the early part of the Bernanke Q&A, diving nearly...

    Ouch! Gold (GLD -0.8%) isn't liking the early part of the Bernanke Q&A, diving nearly $20/ounce to $1,279. "I think the market is beginning to understand our message, and the volatility has moderated," he says, responding to a question about June's dive following the float of tapering. His remarks suggest the point of the June press conference dinger was to curb market enthusiasm. Stocks and bonds have given up some of their gains as well.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM | 5 Comments
  • INFN

    Optical networking hardware vendors Infinera (INFN +2.7%) and Ciena (CIEN +1.6%) rally after...

    Optical networking hardware vendors Infinera (INFN +2.7%) and Ciena (CIEN +1.6%) rally after William Blair starts coverage with an Outperform. Shares of both companies have soared over the last 3 months, fueled by strong earnings reports (I, II) and expectations of a surge in 100G transmission system deployments. Infinera's Q2 report arrives on July 24.

    Broadcom (BRCM -4.3%) dives after Barclays reports a teardown of Samsung's Galaxy S4 Mini indicates Qualcomm's (QCOM +0.4%) Atheros unit is the phone's Wi-Fi/Bluetooth combo chip supplier; the firm estimates Broadcom gets 28%-30% of its sales from combo chips. Broadcom has a dominant share of the combo chip market, aided by design wins for flagships such as the iPhone 5 and Galaxy S4. The S4 Mini (unlike the regular S4) doesn't support the next-gen 802.11ac Wi-Fi standard, which Broadcom has bet big on. Samsung made acquisitions (I, II) last year that suggest it wants to build its own combo chips, at least for low-end hardware.
